page.title: 13WELLINGTON HEATH TODAY
page.content: The village of Wellington Heath is {situated}2 miles north of Ledbury and its railway station, and only 4 miles away from the M 50. It has grown as a {sector of Ledbury,}where most of it's inhabitants work, but it is also good {commuter country. This{residential area,}which has more than{doubled} since 1954 when mains water was laid on, followed in 1974 by mains sewerage, is mostly clustered round the Common and a B Rd to Ledbury The {population} of 500 live in 200 houses - a 5-fold increase in the last 20 yrs.{Further building is unlikely, as residents stress at every Parish Council AGM that more houses should be banned and that they wish to remain a {rural community,}with no lighting or gas and few other amenities. The residents are either elderly or young families, with few teenagers.
